channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023061726
item.description:
Report X-2023061726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: MOSINEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package brought to QA because it was leaking. Placed in bag in bin. DescribePack: Loose cap on one gallon, burst cap on the other gallon. Both gallon jugs are almost empty. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Placed in bag in bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report E-2023070132
item.description:
Report E-2023070132

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of oil (un3082) had a bad seam on the side of the drum and that 6 ounces had been released. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanu the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023070087
item.description:
Report E-2023070087

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading a straight truck at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI, a 15 gallon steel drum fell over. As the drum fell, the contents of the drum shifted and created a spark which resulted in the lid shooting off. The Veolia employees offloading the truck witnessed a ball of light come from the drum. Upon inspection, it was discovered that the drum contained multiple lead acid batteries which were not protected from short circuiting as well as two luminous tube transformers. This incident resulted in a vapor release only, due to pressure build up with the drum. No amount hazard material was released as a result of the incident.

item.title: Report X-2023061654
item.description:
Report X-2023061654

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat shipment was brought over form trailer unload. Package handler stated the box fell off of the noncompliant conveyer belt. When it fell it tipped upside down, and started to leak. DescribePack: All of the plastic bottle bottles didn't have inner cap seals. 2 had visibly loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package handler put the box in a plastic spill bag. then it was put into a have mat tote.
